item.title: Robert Willig has passed away
item.description:
Florian Ederer on Twitter

“Robert Willig, a giant of antitrust economics, has passed away. He is most famous for developing the concept of contestable markets (with Baumol & Panzar) and for validating the use of consumer surplus as a tool of welfare economics. https://t.co/ygooFvO5dx”

URL: https://twitter.com/florianederer/status/1583574653796175872

item.title: Elad on how well will the new AI companies capture value.
item.description:
Elad Gil on Twitter

“(1/N) Every tech wave results in a different split of startup vs incumbent value “Value” means: -Market cap -Revenue, profits, margin -The best people join -Societal impact I wrote a new post about will happen to AI companies: https://t.co/CvalQpieIv”

URL: https://twitter.com/eladgil/status/1583122409137131520

item.title: Brits in their 40s-60s are screwing it up
item.description:
Colin Angus on Twitter

“Deaths in England & Wales from drug poisoning (in red) and alcohol-specific causes (in blue) have different age profiles, but rates of both have risen sharply in the last few years, particularly in people in their 40s-60s.”

URL: https://twitter.com/victimofmaths/status/1582660632482308096?s=46&t=X2G85Ib__u4547d-91qhdg

item.title: Eels
item.description:
Dr Eelmily Finch on Twitter

“Ok folks. It’s time we talked about eels. I’m a geologist but I recently learnt about eels and… wow. Since then, I’ve been greeting strangers with ‘DO YOU KNOW ABOUT EELS?!’ Well, consider yourself a stranger in my path. Strap in. It’s a 🧵 1/so many”

URL: https://twitter.com/DrEmilyFinch/status/1582299378655850499?s=20&t=AnwznlLx_RB-9oze_vj4Zw
